term_definitions.items: Additional contextual detail to be applied to all compositions.

The period of care to which this composition belongs. This equates to the CONTSYS concept and repesents an admisitrative or contractual spell of care, involving a specific instiution or care provider.
The identifier of the departmental period of care to which this Composition belongs.
Portlet ID from which stores the information where was the composition saved.
DICOM based coordinate based system for accurate object localisation.
Description of coordinate system and origin reference point used for localizing the object.
Location of object (nominal center) relative to the Position Frame Reference. Distance can be given in SI units or pixels. of ({pixel}, UCUM, Pixels).
Location of object (nominal center) relative to the Position Frame Reference. Distance can be given in SI units or pixels. of ({pixel}, UCUM, Pixels).
Location of object (nominal center) relative to the Position Frame Reference. Distance can be given in SI units or pixels. of ({pixel}, UCUM, Pixels).
Record details about an anatomical location.
Record details about the anatomical location of a specimen or body part, including precise localisation information.
Named anatomical location - ideally would be coded where possible.
Specify lateraility of the anatomical location.
Qualifier to identify which direction the anatomical location is in relation to the identified landmark.
Relative location medial to the landmark.
Relative location lateral to the landmark.
Relative location superior to the landmark.
Relative location inferior to the landmark.
In the sagittal plane passing through the midline of the body.
Relative location anterior to the landmark.
Relative location posterior to the landmark.
Relative location inferior and medial to the landmark.
Relative location superior and lateral to the landmark.
Relative location inferior and medial to the landmark.
Relative location superior and medial to the landmark.

Qualifiers to identify non-specific location eg 5cm (distance) inferior (aspect) to the tibial tuberosity (landmark). There may be more than one relative location required to provide a cross reference.
Identified anatomical landmark from which to specify relative anatomical location.
Distance of location from the identified landmark.
Line describing the position of a vertical anatomical plane in the body.
In the sagittal plane passing through mid-clavical.
In the coronal plane passing through mid-axilla.
In the sagittal plane passing through mid-scapula.
Identify the specific anatomical site out of multiple eg tenth rib; fourth vertebra; second toe.
Ordinal position 1 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 2 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 3 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 4 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 5 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 6 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 7 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 8 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 9 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 10 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 11 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 12 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 13 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 14 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 15 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 16 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 17 of an anatomical location.
Ordinal position 18 of an anatomical location.
Image or images used to identify a location.
Description of any visual markings used to orientate the viewer e.g external reference points, special sutures, ink markings.
The location of the palpable thyroid mass.
The estimated diameter of the palpated mass.
The diameter of the mass as drawn on the image.
Findings observed during the physical examination of a specified body system or anatomical structure.

May be used to record a narrative summary of the complete clinical examination of the body system or anatomical strucutre or key aspects of physical examination findings, which will be further supported by the additional structured data, using CLUSTER archetypes in the 'Examination Detail' slot. This data element may be used to capture legacy data that is not available in a structured format.
Narrative description of the overall findings observed during a physical examination of a specified body system or anatomical structure.
Structured details of the physical examination for specified body system or anatomical structure.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, if possible. For example, normal examination or a specific physical finding.
Single word, phrase or brief description representing a summary of the physical examination findings.
Coding of the System/Stucture with a terminology is desirable, where possible.
Identification of the body system or anatomical structure examined.
Digital image or video taken, or a diagram drawn, during the physical examination of the body system or anatomical structure.
Findings observed during the physical examination of a subject.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.

May be used to record a narrative summary of the complete clinical examination or key aspects of clinical examination findings, which will be supported by structured data. Details of specific structured findings can be included using CLUSTER archetypes in the 'Examination Detail' slot. This data element may be used to capture legacy data that is not available in a structured format.
Narrative description of the overall findings observed during a physical examination of a patient.
Structured details of the physical examination.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, if possible. For example, normal examination or chronic otitis media.
Single word, phrase or brief description represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.
Description of any incidental factors that may have contributed to the physical examination findings.
Details about any device used during the physical examination.
Any additional narrative comment not covered by other elements.
Generic encounter or progress note composition

items.items: Generic encounter or progress note composition
Findings observed during the physical examination of a subject.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.

May be used to record a narrative summary of the complete clinical examination or key aspects of clinical examination findings, which will be supported by structured data. Details of specific structured findings can be included using CLUSTER archetypes in the 'Examination Detail' slot. This data element may be used to capture legacy data that is not available in a structured format.
Narrative description of the overall findings observed during a physical examination of a patient.
Structured details of the physical examination.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, if possible. For example, normal examination or chronic otitis media.
Single word, phrase or brief description represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.
Description of any incidental factors that may have contributed to the physical examination findings.
Details about any device used during the physical examination.
Any additional narrative comment not covered by other elements.
Findings observed during the physical examination of a specified body system or anatomical structure.

May be used to record a narrative summary of the complete clinical examination of the body system or anatomical strucutre or key aspects of physical examination findings, which will be further supported by the additional structured data, using CLUSTER archetypes in the 'Examination Detail' slot. This data element may be used to capture legacy data that is not available in a structured format.
Narrative description of the overall findings observed during a physical examination of a specified body system or anatomical structure.
Structured details of the physical examination for specified body system or anatomical structure.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, if possible. For example, normal examination or a specific physical finding.
Single word, phrase or brief description representing a summary of the physical examination findings.
Coding of the System/Stucture with a terminology is desirable, where possible.
Identification of the body system or anatomical structure examined.
Digital image or video taken, or a diagram drawn, during the physical examination of the body system or anatomical structure.

The diameter of the mass as drawn on the image.
